title: TV Host Crosses The Line With Comment About Conway
text:
TV Host Crosses The Line With Comment About Conway "She's good at ..." Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
One co-host of a Philadelphia morning show has some unexpected time off after delivering a succinct, yet profane, summation of White House counselor Kellyanne Conway ‘s skills. 
The fuss began when Good Day Philadelphia discussed Conway’s recent Meet the Press interview. Conway’s quote about “alternative facts” was a bit too much for Mike Jerrick, who then blurted out his opinion. 
After some embarrassed laughter, the hosts tried to regroup. 
“We’re sorry about that,” co-host Alex Holley said following Jerrick’s comment. Advertisement - story continues below 
“I apologize for that,” Jerrick added. 
The episode was shrugged aside by some of the show’s viewers. Just learned that @MikeFOX29 has been suspended.That's some BS! Switching channels until Mike is back.Way to go @FOX29philly Jon Voight: Miley Cyrus And Shia LaBeouf Are ‘Teaching Treason’ 
The station was not among those inclined to let the whole thing slide. It suspended Jerrick for a week. 
Jerrick maintained a public nonchalance about his suspension, tweeting that he would use his first night off to attend a hockey game. Night off. Why not. Always a good fight. #philadelphia … https://t.co/5jNCk8wcWP 
— Mike Jerrick (@MikeFOX29) January 26, 2017 
A Fox statement said Jerrick’s comments were “not in line with Fox Television Stations guidelines and the matter has been addressed.” 
Jerrick is expected to return to the show next week. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
